property.name: description
property.value: The Onshore Seismic Data of Australia is a collection of all land seismic traverses cross the Australian continent and its margins. The data includes raw and processed data in SEGY format. The metadata includes acquisition reports, processing reports, processed images, logs, and so on. The data acquisition was carried out in Australia from 1949-2012 by Geoscience Australia and various partners. The set of reflection and refraction data comprises over 12,000 km of coverage, and provides an insight into the variations in crustal architecture in the varied geological domains. The complete processed dataset was first available for public access in Oct 2013 (http://www.ga.gov.au/minerals/projects/current-projects/seismic-acquisition-processing.html ). The location of seismic traverses is shown by the Gallery link on the webpage. The new survey data will be updated on the webpage by the official data release date. The attribute structure of the dataset has also been revised to be more compatible with the GeoSciML data standard, published by the IUGS Commission for Geoscience Information. The onshore seismic data were collected with partner organizations: Australian Geodynamics Cooperative Research Centre, National Research Facility for Earth Sounding, Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation, Cooperative Research Centre for Greenhouse Gas Technologies, Curtin University of Technology, Geological Survey of New South Wales, NSW Department of Mineral Resources, NSW Department of Primary Industries Mineral Resources, An organisation for a National Earth Science Infrastructure Program, Geological Survey Western Australia, Northern Territory Geological Survey, Primary Industries and Resources South Australia, Predictive Mineral Discovery Cooperative Research Centre, Queensland Geological Survey, GeoScience Victoria Department of Primary Industries, Tasmania Development and Resources, University of Western Australia.

property.name: description
property.value: A collection of scientific reports that have been spatially located

property.name: description
property.value: Raw Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) data from ERS-1 and ERS-2 satellites. Data is provided in the standardised CEOS format under licence from the European Space Agency (ESA).

property.name: description
property.value: This is the parent datafile of a datset that comprises a set of 14+ geoscience products made up of mosaiced ASTER scenes across Australia.

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map AlOH group composition

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B7Blue is well ordered kaolinite, Al-rich muscovite/illite, paragonite, pyrophyllite Red is Al-poor (Si-rich) muscovite (phengite)

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map Ferrous iron index

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B4Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance

property.name: description
property.value: Useful for mapping the Al-clay mineral composition of the surface soils and exposed geology. Kaolin (cooler tones) can be an indicator for lower pH whereas illite-montmorillonite (warmer tones) can be an indicator for higher pH.

property.name: description
property.value: Water content of the surface after removing atmospheric path-length (topography) dependent water vapour using the ASTER GDEM-2 digital elevation model. Higher levels of surface water (warmer tones) can be related to: (i) wet soil after snow melt; (ii) green vegetation; (iii) hydroscopic minerals like illite and montmorillonite; (iii) and/or groundwater seepage.

property.name: description
property.value: Useful for mapping the Al-clay mineral composition of the surface soils and exposed geology. Kaolin (cooler tones) can be an indicator for lower pH whereas illite-montmorillonite (warmer tones) can be an indicator for higher pH.

property.name: description
property.value: Equivalent to false colour infrared photography and Landsat band colour composite R:4; G:3; B:2. Green vegetation produces red colour.

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B1/B4Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance(potentially includes carbon black (e.g. ash), magnetite, Mn oxides, and sulphides in unoxidised envornments

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map Ferric oxide content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B4/B3Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map FeOH group content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B6+B8)/B7Blue is low content, Red is high content(potentially includes: chlorite, epidote, jarosite, nontronite, gibbsite, gypsum, opal-chalcedony)

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map Ferric oxide composition

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B2/B1Blue-cyan is goethite rich, Green is hematite-goethite, Red-yellow is hematite-rich

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map Kaolin group index

property.name: description
property.value: B6/B5(potential includes: pyrophyllite, alunite, well-ordered kaolinite)Blue is low content, Red is high content

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map TIR Quartz index

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B11/(B10+B12)Blue is low quartz contentRed is high quartz content

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map MgOH group content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B6+B9/(B7+B8)Blue is low content, Red is high content(potentially includes: calcite, dolomite, magnesite, chlorite, epidote, amphibole, talc, serpentine)

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map green vegetation content

property.name: description
property.value: Band ratio: B3/B2 Blue is low contentRed is high content

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map Ferrous iron content in MgOH/carbonate

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B5/B4Blue is low ferrous iron content in carbonate and MgOH minerals like talc and tremolite.Red is high ferrous iron content in carbonate and MgOH minerals like chlorite and actinolite.

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map MgOH group composition

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B7/B8Blue-cyan is magnesite-dolomite, amphibole, chlorite\tRed is calcite, epidote, amphibole

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map false colour mosaic

property.name: description
property.value: 1. False colour RGB composite Red: B3Green: B2Blue: B1(red = green vegetation)

property.name: description
property.value: 1. 3 band RGB composite Red: B3/B2Green: B3/B7Blue: B4/B7(white = green vegetation)

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map AlOH group content

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B5+B7)/B6Blue is low abundance, Red is high abundance potentially includes: phengite, muscovite, paragonite, lepidolite, illite, brammalite, montmorillonite, beidellite, kaolinite, dickite

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map TIR Gypsum index

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: (B10+B12)/B11Blue is low gypsum contentRed is high gypsum content

property.name: name
property.value: National ASTER Map TIR Silica index

property.name: description
property.value: 1. Band ratio: B13/B10Blue is low silica contentRed is high silica content(potentially includes Si-rich minerals, such as quartz, feldspars, Al-clays)
